result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Salazar Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Provide DNA Sample, if not already done so

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel Salazar Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miguel Salazar in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT239, 16CT71, 16CM151 and 15TR2266. 
**Plea and Waiver of Rights Information read to all defendants present prior to any pleas/sentencing taking place.

8:57 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT239:
Count 1 - No contest
16CT71:
Count 1 - DRI
16CM151:
Count 1 - No contest 
15TR2266:
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CT239, Count 1 of 16CM151 and Count 1 on 15TR2266 and Count 1 of 16CT71 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CT239:
Count 1 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so 
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan

16CT71:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM151:
Count 1 - 
Pay $200 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so 
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 

15TR2266:
Forfeiture of $175.30 
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 

**ANY BOND MONIES POSTED TO BE APPLIED TO FINES/COSTS
**WARRANTS ON 16CT71 AND 16CM151 ARE QUASHED
Plea hearing on August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15TR-2266, 16CM-151, 16CT-71 and 15CT-239.

11:29 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins  states appearances.

Atty Drengler represents Defendant, does not know where his client is, tried reaching him this morning, did not get a response.

State requests bench warrant on all 3 files. State requests default judgment in 15TR-2266.

Court notes Defendant was sent notice for today's hearing.
In 15CT-239, notice was returned, moved, left no address, unable to forward.

BY THE COURT:
16CM-151: Authorize Bench Warrant, $300 cash alternative
16CT-71: Authorize Bench Warrant, $300 cash alternative
15CT-239: Authorize Bench Warrant, $300 cash alternative
15TR-2266: Default Judgment $175.30
Plea hearing on June 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Record Update. Original filed in 15CT-239

ADDRESS INFO for Miguel Salazar Jr
Current: 60 Pine Grove Villa, Bancroft, WI 54921 United States  (Effective: 05-02-2016)
Prior: 5445 Cth W  Lot 42, Bancroft, WI 54921

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

This bond covers both 16CM151 & 16CT71:
Comply with all conditions of other outstanding bonds.

Defendant Miguel Salazar in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM151, 16CT71

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $1000 signature bond with conditions as stated to cover both files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
